required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Clinical Trial to Evaluate Long-term Immunogenicity and Boostability of Purified Chick-Embryo Cell Rabies Vaccine in Adults Following Primary Series of Pre/Exposure Prophylaxis.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Open-label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate Long-term Immunogenicity and Boostability of Immune Responses in Adults Who Received Different Primary Vaccination Regimens of Pre-exposure Prophylaxis With Purified Chick-Embryo Cell Rabies Vaccine Administered Concomitantly or Separately From a Japanese Encephalitis Vaccine.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the long-term (up to approx.10 years) persistence and to assess the boostability of immune responses in subjects who received a primary series of accelerated or conventional rabies PrEP IM regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary immunogenicity endpoints will be based on the concentrations at Year 3, following a primary series of accelerated or conventional rabies PrEP IM regimen, as measured by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test (RFFIT).
primary_outcome.description: *RVNA : Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibodies. RFFIT : Rapid Fluorescent Focus Inhibition Test.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary immunogenicity endpoints will be based on the concentrations at Year 4 following a primary series of accelerated or conventional rabies PrEP IM regimen, as measured by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test (RFFIT).

The primary immunogenicity endpoints will be based on the concentrations at Year 10 following a primary series of accelerated or conventional rabies PrEP IM regimen, as measured by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test (RFFIT).
Time to first RVNA concentrations < 0.5 IU/mL.
primary_outcome.time_frame: All study duration (outcome measure is a time so we cannot specify the particular timepoint)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) for subjects receiving the booster dose at 7 days after the booster dose
Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) for subjects receiving the booster dose.
Geometric Mean Ratios (GMRs) for subjects receiving the booster dose, as measured by antibody concentration at 7 days after the booster dose vs. antibody concentration before the booster dose.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after the booster dose vs. antibody concentration before the booster dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of subjects with RVNA concentrations ≥ 0.5 IU/mL, as measured by RFFIT assay at 7 days after the booster dose and at subsequent Scheduled Clinic Visits.

arm_group.description: Subjects who received a primary series of accelerated or conventional rabies PrEP IM regimen in the parent study, will receive a booster dose based on their individual antibody concentrations measured over time.

intervention.description: 1 booster dose of 1.0 mL of Purified Chick-Embryo Cell Rabies Vaccine intramuscular (IM)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All individuals who were randomized to a Rabies primary series vaccination for pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP), received the full PrEP regimen and completed the parent trial following study protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Completed the parent study without receiving the full 3 rabies vaccine doses following the assigned pre-exposure prophylaxis regimen.
- History of exposure to suspected or confirmed rabid animal.
- Receipt of rabies immunoglobulins, rabies post exposure prophylaxis following completion of the parent study
